designations.source: A review of the status of the caddis flies (Trichoptera) of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of caddis from work originally undertaken in 1987 and 1991 respectively, using the IUCN methodology for assessing threat.
designations.reporting_category: Nationally Scarce, Nationally Rare and Other Species
designations.designation: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
designations.designation_description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Includes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.

designations.source: A review of the status of the caddis flies (Trichoptera) of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of caddis from work originally undertaken in 1987 and 1991 respectively, using the IUCN methodology for assessing threat.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.
designations.comments: Historic decline and few modern sites. Lack of knowledge of exact larval requirements makes specific conservation measures difficult to plan.
